title: Information disclosure at lite.uber.com
vulnerability_information:
Hello!
1. At https://lite.uber.com/auth/login I get 302-redirect to https://login.uber.com.
2. After post my email and password I get callback to https://lite.uber.com/auth/callback?code=efopqUAx2uwMOqJafHGj2OP8yNxXkf#_
3. At this page we can see trace stack with names of nodejs modules, full path disclose...

File attached.

Best Wishes!
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello!

  1. At https://lite.uber.com/auth/login I get 302-redirect to https://login.uber.com.
  2. After post my email and password I get callback to https://lite.uber.com/auth/callback?code=efopqUAx2uwMOqJafHGj2OP8yNxXkf#_
  3. At this page we can see trace stack with names of nodejs modules, full path disclose...

File attached.

Best Wishes!

activities.message:
Hello!
It look's like fixed now.
Did it was error in oauth implementation  at login.uber.com ?
Best Wishes!
activities.markdown_message:
Hello!
It look's like fixed now.
Did it was error in oauth implementation at login.uber.com ?
Best Wishes!

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.  

I don't believe any changes were made here based on your report.  Are you still not able to reproduce the behavior you are concerned about?  When I try this, I only get an error page.  Can you confirm that this is no longer reproducible?  If so, you may wish to close this issue on your own to avoid any reputation loss.

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report.

I don't believe any changes were made here based on your report. Are you still not able to reproduce the behavior you are concerned about? When I try this, I only get an error page. Can you confirm that this is no longer reproducible? If so, you may wish to close this issue on your own to avoid any reputation loss.

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Yes, I can't reproduce this. but i think there was some fix at login.uber.com.

Yesterday it was only one 302-redirect from https://lite.uber.com to  https://login.uber.com/oauth/v2/authorize?response_type=code&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flite.uber.com%2Fauth%2Fcallback&scope=profile%20history%20places%20history_lite%20request_receipt%20request%20payment_baidu_wallet%20ride_request_control&client_id=y-JJyZ_RABnEwbJQq4VdQPORo4EKqv0j  but now I see two 302 redirect (additional redirect to https://login.uber.com/login).

I agree that this fix can be not related to my report. But if attached screenshot contains  your modules and full path disclosure, you must agree that there was issue. After all, I could not fabricate them))
Thank's
activities.markdown_message:
Yes, I can't reproduce this. but i think there was some fix at login.uber.com.

Yesterday it was only one 302-redirect from https://lite.uber.com to https://login.uber.com/oauth/v2/authorize?response_type=code&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flite.uber.com%2Fauth%2Fcallback&scope=profile%20history%20places%20history_lite%20request_receipt%20request%20payment_baidu_wallet%20ride_request_control&client_id=y-JJyZ_RABnEwbJQq4VdQPORo4EKqv0j but now I see two 302 redirect (additional redirect to https://login.uber.com/login).

I agree that this fix can be not related to my report. But if attached screenshot contains your modules and full path disclosure, you must agree that there was issue. After all, I could not fabricate them))
Thank's

activities.message:
Thank you for the additional information.

You are correct that there may have been an unrelated fix here which also happened to fix your issue.  Unfortunately, if the issue is no longer reproducible and the fix was part of a previously reported issue, we aren't able to pay a bounty for it.  As such, we will be closing this report as "Informational" so that you do not lose any reputation points.

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for the additional information.

You are correct that there may have been an unrelated fix here which also happened to fix your issue. Unfortunately, if the issue is no longer reproducible and the fix was part of a previously reported issue, we aren't able to pay a bounty for it. As such, we will be closing this report as "Informational" so that you do not lose any reputation points.

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
I think it's not necessary to create new report, so I post here:
You have some internal resources, which can be find easy. For example JIRA at 
jira.uber.com (with redirect to jira.uberinternal.com)
And by using API JIRA I can find something like this:
https://jira.uberinternal.com/rest/api/2/dashboard?maxResults=20&startAt=20

Thanks
activities.markdown_message:
I think it's not necessary to create new report, so I post here:
You have some internal resources, which can be find easy. For example JIRA at
jira.uber.com (with redirect to jira.uberinternal.com)
And by using API JIRA I can find something like this:
https://jira.uberinternal.com/rest/api/2/dashboard?maxResults=20&startAt=20

Thanks

activities.message:
And I think initial issue occurs when user want to connect YellowRiver app to his account.
Go to this link
https://login.uber.com/oauth/v2/authorize?response_type=code&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flite.uber.com%2Fauth%2Fcallback&scope=profile%20history%20places%20history_lite%20request_receipt%20request%20payment_baidu_wallet&client_id=y-JJyZ_RABnEwbJQq4VdQPORo4EKqv0j

after login you will see it.


So after looking at trace of initial issue (screenshot), i propose that issue occurs when user have Alipay as payment method. But I can't reproduce it because don't see now options to add Alipay in my account. If you can you can test it again.
Now if I allow YellowRiver I can see only 500 Internal Server Error at lite.uber.com

Thanks again!
activities.markdown_message:
And I think initial issue occurs when user want to connect YellowRiver app to his account.
Go to this link
https://login.uber.com/oauth/v2/authorize?response_type=code&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flite.uber.com%2Fauth%2Fcallback&scope=profile%20history%20places%20history_lite%20request_receipt%20request%20payment_baidu_wallet&client_id=y-JJyZ_RABnEwbJQq4VdQPORo4EKqv0j

after login you will see it.

So after looking at trace of initial issue (screenshot), i propose that issue occurs when user have Alipay as payment method. But I can't reproduce it because don't see now options to add Alipay in my account. If you can you can test it again.
Now if I allow YellowRiver I can see only 500 Internal Server Error at lite.uber.com

Thanks again!
